  • Method Details

    • getChangesById

      public QueryApi.GetChangesByIdAdapter getChangesById(String hrn, String layerId, List<String> partition, Optional<String> startVersion, Optional<String> endVersion, Optional<Long> sinceTime, Optional<String> context, List<String> additionalFields, Optional<String> billingTag)
      Gets the latest partition changes for a version range in a versioned layer or a time range for a volatile layer. Only the latest change for each changed partition is returned, not intermediate changes. If the response contains a partition with an empty 'dataHandle' value, the partition was deleted at the version indicated by the 'version' field of the partition object. If a partition was created and deleted between the versions specified in the 'startVersion' and 'endVersion' parameters, the partition is not included in the response. For example, if you request versions 0 to 10, and a partition was created in version 3 then deleted in version 7, it is not included in the response.

      Path: /layers/{layerId}/changes

      Method: GET

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : Partitions (OK) Headers : Last-Modified - For volatile layers, contains the latest date and time at which a returned partition's data was modified.

      code 400 : (Required parameters are missing)

      code 401 : (Unauthorized)

      code 403 : (Forbidden)

      code 404 : (Catalog or layer does not exist)

      Parameters:
      hrn - The HERE Resource Name (HRN) of the catalog.
      layerId - The ID of the layer specified in the request. The value of this parameter must refer to a valid layer already configured in the catalog configuration. You can specify multiple layers as additional parameters.
      partition - The partitions you want to include in the response. This allows you to limit the response to specific partitions. You can specify multiple partitions by using this parameter multiple times. The maximum number of partitions per call is 100.
      startVersion - Start version for the catalog (exclusive). By convention -1 indicates the virtual initial version before the first publication which will have version 0.
      endVersion - End version (inclusive). This has to be a valid catalog version greater than the startVersion.
      sinceTime - Will return partitions whose data has been modified since this time, in milliseconds since epoch, inclusive.
      context - The context where the operation will be performed on a composite layers. Only available for versioned layers. Available context are: |Context|Description| |-------|-----------| |default|The default value if none is given. For composite layers the operation is executed for both layers current and the layer it extends. For normal layers this is the only valid context.| |extension|The operation will be executed only in the extension and no operation will be performed in the extended layer.| |super| The operation will be executed only in the layer being extended (super layer).|
      additionalFields - Additional fields - dataSize, checksum, compressedDataSize, crc.
      billingTag - Billing Tag is an optional free-form tag which is used for grouping billing records together. If supplied, it must be between 4 - 16 characters, contain only alpha/numeric ASCII characters [A-Za-z0-9]. Grouping billing records by billing tag will be available in future releases.

    • getChangesById

      public QueryApi.GetChangesByIdBuilder getChangesById()

    • getPartitionsById

      public QueryApi.GetPartitionsByIdAdapter getPartitionsById(String hrn, String layerId, List<String> partition, Optional<String> version, Optional<String> context, List<String> additionalFields, Optional<String> billingTag)
      Gets metadata for specific partition ids. If the layer specified in the request does not exist, the request results in an error. If a partition specified in the request does not exist, the response does not include this partition. Maximum allowed number of partitions ids per call is 100.

      Path: /layers/{layerId}/partitions

      Method: GET

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : Partitions (OK - Your search for partitions is a valid request.)

      code 400 : (Required parameters are missing)

      code 401 : (Unauthorized)

      code 403 : (Forbidden)

      code 404 : (Catalog or layer does not exist)

      Parameters:
      hrn - The HERE Resource Name (HRN) of the catalog.
      layerId - The ID of the layer specified in the request. The content of this parameter must refer to a valid layer already configured in the catalog configuration. You can specify multiple partitions by using this parameter multiple times.
      partition - Partition ids to use for filtering. You can specify multiple partitions by using this parameter multiple times. Maximum allowed partitions ids per call is 100.
      version - The version of the catalog against which to run the query. Must be a valid catalog version.
      context - The context where the operation will be performed on a composite layers. Only available for versioned layers. Available context are: |Context|Description| |-------|-----------| |default|The default value if none is given. For composite layers the operation is executed for both layers current and the layer it extends. For normal layers this is the only valid context.| |extension|The operation will be executed only in the extension and no operation will be performed in the extended layer.| |super| The operation will be executed only in the layer being extended (super layer).|
      additionalFields - Additional fields - dataSize, checksum, compressedDataSize, crc.
      billingTag - Billing Tag is an optional free-form tag which is used for grouping billing records together. If supplied, it must be between 4 - 16 characters, contain only alpha/numeric ASCII characters [A-Za-z0-9]. Grouping billing records by billing tag will be available in future releases.

    • getPartitionsById

      public QueryApi.GetPartitionsByIdBuilder getPartitionsById()

    • quadTreeIndex

      public QueryApi.QuadTreeIndexAdapter quadTreeIndex(String hrn, String layerId, Long version, String quadKey, Integer depth, Optional<String> context, List<String> additionalFields, Optional<String> billingTag)
      Gets metadata for the requested index. Only available for versioned layers where the partitioning scheme is heretile.

      Path: /layers/{layerId}/versions/{version}/quadkeys/{quadKey}/depths/{depth}

      Method: GET

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : Index (OK)

      code 400 : (Required parameters are missing)

      code 401 : (Unauthorized)

      code 403 : (Forbidden)

      code 404 : (Not Found)

      Parameters:
      hrn - The HERE Resource Name (HRN) of the catalog.
      layerId - The ID of the layer specified in the request. Content of this parameter must refer to a valid layer already configured in the catalog configuration. Exactly one layer ID must be provided.
      version - The version of the catalog against which to run the query. Must be a valid catalog version.
      quadKey - The geometric area specified by an index in the request, represented as a HERE tile
      depth - The recursion depth of the response. If set to 0, the response includes only data for the quadKey specified in the request. In this way, depth describes the maximum length of the subQuadKeys in the response. The maximum allowed value for the depth parameter is 4.
      context - The context where the operation will be performed on a composite layers. Only available for versioned layers. Available context are: |Context|Description| |-------|-----------| |default|The default value if none is given. For composite layers the operation is executed for both layers current and the layer it extends. For normal layers this is the only valid context.| |extension|The operation will be executed only in the extension and no operation will be performed in the extended layer.| |super| The operation will be executed only in the layer being extended (super layer).|
      additionalFields - Additional fields - dataSize, checksum, compressedDataSize, crc.
      billingTag - Billing Tag is an optional free-form tag used to group billing records together. If supplied, it must be between 4 - 16 characters and contain only alphanumeric ASCII characters [A-Za-z0-9]. Grouping billing records by billing tag will be available in a future release.

    • quadTreeIndex

      public QueryApi.QuadTreeIndexBuilder quadTreeIndex()

    • quadTreeIndexVolatile

      public QueryApi.QuadTreeIndexVolatileAdapter quadTreeIndexVolatile(String hrn, String layerId, String quadKey, Integer depth, List<String> additionalFields, Optional<String> billingTag)
      Gets metadata for the requested index. Only available for volatile layers where the partitioning scheme is heretile.

      Path: /layers/{layerId}/quadkeys/{quadKey}/depths/{depth}

      Method: GET

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : Index (OK)

      code 400 : (Required parameters are missing)

      code 401 : (Unauthorized)

      code 403 : (Forbidden)

      code 404 : (Not Found)

      Parameters:
      hrn - The HERE Resource Name (HRN) of the catalog.
      layerId - The ID of the layer specified in the request. Content of this parameter must refer to a valid layer already configured in the catalog configuration. Exactly one layer ID must be provided.
      quadKey - The geometric area specified by an index in the request, represented as a HERE tile
      depth - The recursion depth of the response. If set to 0, the response includes only data for the quadKey specified in the request. In this way, depth describes the maximum length of the subQuadKeys in the response. The maximum allowed value for the depth parameter is 4.
      additionalFields - Additional fields - dataSize, checksum, compressedDataSize, crc.
      billingTag - Billing Tag is an optional free-form tag used to group billing records together. If supplied, it must be between 4 - 16 characters and contain only alphanumeric ASCII characters [A-Za-z0-9]. Grouping billing records by billing tag will be available in a future release.

      public QueryApi.QuadTreeIndexVolatileBuilder quadTreeIndexVolatile()
